text:
> Now to get the ftp side working and all is gravy
out of curiosity, what is the ftp side needed for?

:wave: - Happy Friday!

Just wanted let everyone know that we just released a new version (1.0.0) of the CLI that has some improved error checking. The code for the NPM packages also is now *open source*! See <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-tools>. We also have added a webpack plugin that makes it pretty straightforward to configure webpack to automatically upload built files to HubSpot, which together with `webpack --watch` provides a good dev experience. See <https://www.npmjs.com/package/@HubSpot/webpack-cms-plugins>. Moving forward we’re going to leverage <https://semver.org/> for versioning.

Run `npm install -g @HubSpot/cms-cli@latest` to update your version and get access to these new features!

<@U22VBL87M> Thanks for asking! Where I'm at, I work as a designer/developer, so I am constantly designing/updating graphics and assets as well as coding. I want to have a local asset folder with cms assets and a watcher that auto uploads when a files changes to the FM (so content folks can access the graphics as well.)
I've got this all working with vinyl-ftp and gulp, except for the "only changed files" piece. gulp-newer isn't playing well and either uploads everything or nothing.
<@UJQNNKKHN> mentioned gulp-cached, I just haven't had a chance to try it out yet
I think it’s a joke about person skipping over Halloween to put up xmas decorations. The unicorn is not amused
what holiday does the unicorn represent? IPO day?
maybe its wework just being bummed out...
